entry.title: Hedge funds added Apple shares in second quarter, filings show
entry.summary: At the end of the first quarter Apple was one of the most popular stocks owned by hedge funds, according to Goldman Sachs research.

entry.title: Hedge funds added Apple shares in second quarter, filings show
entry.summary:
Still, during the first quarter of this year a number of hedge funds cut their stakes in Apple as its shares rallied, previous filings showed.

Apple remains the most valuable U.S. company, with a market capitalization $657 billion.

BOSTON (Reuters) - Top U.S. hedge funds added to their positions in Apple Inc (AAPL.O) during the second quarter, even as shares of the iPhone maker were flat during the period.

Bridgewater Associates LP was a seller, however, cutting its Apple stake by 201,500 shares to 531,497 shares, filings show.

The decline could have exposed the second-quarter hedge fund buyers to losses, though some might have exited Apple before it fell from a high of $132.07 on July 20.

Their analysis of 685 hedge funds with nearly $1 trillion in equity assets found 69 of the funds had Apple among their top 10 holdings.

Tiger Eye Capital LLC added 25,000 shares of Apple to bring its total stake to 356,502 shares, filings showed.

entry.title: Apple says hired 65 percent more women in past year
entry.summary: Apple said it had hired over 11,000 women globally in the past year-65 percent more than the previous year-to boost employee diversity.

entry.title: Apple more than doubles hiring of women and minorities
entry.summary:
Like other major tech companies, Apple has been under public pressure to increase the number of women and minorities in a workforce that is overwhelmingly male and white or Asian.

Apple Inc. said 35 percent of its new hires worldwide last year were women, while 24 percent of U.S. hires were black or Hispanic.

As a result, Apple's global workforce of 110,000 is now 31 percent women, up from 30 percent last year.

But Jackson said he wants Apple and other tech companies to go beyond the federal report and provide more "comprehensive" data on hiring as well as purchasing and contracting with companies owned by women and minorities.

entry.title: Apple more than doubles hiring of women and minorities
Apple said to delay streaming TV service to 2016 as negotiations stall
entry.summary:
Just as Apple once convinced music labels to sell songs for a lowly 99 cents, it wants to offer a package of popular channels for $40 a month, the people said.

Apple, which has been trying for more than a decade to remake video entertainment, is struggling to find the right mix of channels to appeal to cord-cutters for about $40, said the people, who couldn't say when or if the negotiations would be completed.

entry.title: Apple to delay live TV service to next year: Bloomberg
entry.summary:
Apple also lacked the computer network capacity to ensure a good viewing experience, Bloomberg said.

The company still plans to introduce a more powerful version of its Apple TV set-top box at the event, which will be held in San Francisco.

entry.title: Who are the stock market heavyweights?
entry.summary: At the end of 1985, the company's stock made up 6.4 percent of the S&P 500's total value, much bigger than Apple's current 3.6 percent.

entry.title: When heavyweights like Apple, Microsoft, and Exxon move, the market reacts
entry.summary:
NEW YORK - At $654 billion, Apple is the stock market's heavyweight.

"The combination of Apple's size and price moves, results in an enormous impact on indices," says Howard Silverblatt, a senior index analyst for S&P Dow Jones Indices.

Lately, Apple's influence has been a drag.

Since closing at a record $133 on February 23, Apple has slumped to $115.40, wiping $115 billion off the value of its stock.

Without Apple, the decline would have been a gain of 0.1 percent, according to S&P Dow Jones Indices, the company behind the S&P 500 index and the Dow Jones industrial average.

Either way, for every $1 change in Apple stock, the S&P 500 rises or falls 0.6526 points, says Silverblatt.

The impact of the technology giant is so big that S&P Dow Jones Indices has created a technology index that excludes Apple.

Best Buy, which has more than 1,000 stores in the U.S., says it's the first national retailer to sell the watch outside of Apple Inc.'s stores.

entry.title: Apple Watch to be sold at Best Buy stores from August
entry.summary:
(Reuters) - The Apple Watch will be available at stores of Best Buy Co Inc (BBY.N), the largest U.S. consumer electronics chain, starting Aug. 7.

The Apple Watch and Apple Watch Sport models will be sold at more than 300 Best Buy stores in time for the holiday shopping season, a spokeswoman for Apple Inc (AAPL.O) said.

entry.title: ​For many consumers, Apple Watch isn't a gotta have
entry.summary:
Patrick Clayton, who has had Mac computers all his life and owns an iPhone and several iPads, returned his Apple Watch after three weeks.

Apps will get better when Apple updates the watch's software this fall to permit more "native" apps -- those that aren't just extensions of phone apps.

entry.title: Apple's $62B hit is bad…but it's not the worst
entry.summary:
Despite beating earnings estimates on Tuesday evening, Apple's stock has sunk in after-hours trading and is on course to write a new page in the history books.

It also briefly fell below its 200-day moving average Tuesday and Apple hasn't closed below this metric since Sept.

In January 2013, Apple lost a remarkable $59 billion in market cap, meaning Tuesday's after-hours fall set an unwarranted milestone.

Correction: An earlier version misstated when Apple's stock fell below its 200-day moving average.

NOT JUST APPLE: There was also disappointment that Microsoft booked an $8.4 billion charge related to the write-off of the Nokia phone business it bought just over a year ago.

entry.title: Many Apple fans wait on buying Apple Watch, as early buyers seek improvements
entry.summary:
NEW YORK - For all those who hailed the iPhone as the "Jesus Phone" in 2007, the Apple Watch's arrival has hardly been the second coming.

Early Apple Watch owners seem generally happy with it, but Apple's bigger worry should be those on the sidelines - even hardcore Apple fans, not to mention the rest of us - who are waiting to take the plunge.

Apple Watch also doesn't always provide the right information at the right time.

entry.title: Apple reports record earnings for recent quarter
entry.summary: "We had an amazing quarter, with iPhone revenue up 59 percent over last year, strong sales of Mac, all-time record revenue from services, driven by the App Store, and a great start for Apple Watch," Cook said.

entry.title: Strong iPhone Sales; Apple Stock Down With Few Watch Details
Apple earnings rise on strong iPhone sales but impact of watch remains unclear
entry.summary:
Apple said Tuesday that it sold more than 47.5 million iPhones during the three months ending in June, or 35 per cent more than a year ago.

In one tantalizing clue, Apple reported $2.6 billion in revenue from the segment that includes the watch and several other products, or about $952 million more than the previous quarter, when the watch had not yet gone on sale.

Apple also forecast that revenue for the quarter ending in September will fall between $49 billion and $51 billion, indicating total sales could fall below Wall Street estimates of $50.8 billion.

For the latest quarter, Apple said revenue from all sources grew 33 per cent from last year to $49.6 billion in the April-June quarter, with the iPhone contributing $31.4 billion in sales.

Apple got a big boost from new markets like China, which contributed more than a quarter of the company's revenue, or $13.2 billion.

entry.title: Apple third-quarter profit, revenue beat expectations
entry.summary: Apple said its "other products" category pulled in $2.64 billion in revenue.

entry.title: Apple logs Q3 beat, but Q4 sales outlook disappoints
entry.summary: Apple's sales in China more than doubled from a year earlier to $13.2 billion.

entry.title: Apple says App Store, other services resume after three hours
entry.summary:
(Reuters) - Apple Inc said App Store, Apple Music, iTunes Store and some other services are back online, after a more than three hour outage.

The last time that Apple services were affected this long was in March, when iTunes and the App Store came back online after a mammoth 12-hour outage.

entry.title: Apple says App Store, other services resume after three hours
entry.summary:
The problems seemed to have started just before 10 a.m. ET, and the services resumed around 1:15 p.m. ET according to a timeline on Apple's U.S. support page.

The problems started just before Apple's radio station Beats 1 was supposed to reveal the nominations for MTV's 2015 Video Music Awards.

entry.title: Apple Music, iTunes and App Store Suffer Outages
entry.summary: Apple's Beats 1 station went down during the announcement of nominees for MTV's Video Music Awards.
